Marco Sorrentino

MIT

C
Git Internals
CLI Tool
View Code on GitHub

MIT is a minimal reimplementation of Git written entirely in C. The project was created to deeply understand Git internals, including object storage, references, commits, and repository structure.

Goals

  • Understand how Git works under the hood
  • Implement core Git commands from scratch
  • Practice low-level systems programming in C

Implemented Features

  • mit init – repository initialization
  • mit hash-object – object creation
  • mit cat-file – object inspection
  • Basic object storage (blobs, trees, commits)

Tech Stack

  • C (C17)
  • POSIX APIs
  • Filesystem-based object storage
